citation.article-title: Streptococcus shiloi and Streptococcus difficile: two new streptococcal species causing a menningoencephalitis in fish.

p.s: Description of Streptococcus difficile sp. nov.
Streptococcus difficile (name reflects its fastidious characteristics)
Cells are Gram-positive cocci arranged in small chains with a variable diameter.

Few sugars are acidified: ribose, saccharose, fructose, glucosamine, and maltose (Table 2). Streptococcus difficile strains are not hemolytic, do not grow at 45°C or in the presence of bile salts or of 6.5% NaCl, but grow at pH 9.6.
Colonies on BHI agar plates are about 1 mm in diameter after 48 h incubation at 30°C under aerobic conditions.
The type strain ND 2-22 (CIP103768) was isolated from the brain of a Tilapia.
